newsitem.title: UK: UK govt won't refer Boots buy of Do-It-All.
newsitem.headline: UK govt won't refer Boots buy of Do-It-All.

text.p: The UK Department of Trade and Industry said on Thursday that it would not refer Boots Plc's acquisition of the remaining stake in Do-It-All from its partner W H Smith Group Plc to the Monopolies and Mergers Commission.
Boots has agreed to buy W H Smith 's 50 percent stake, making the UK retailing to pharmacy chain the sole owner of the home improvement company.

Under the agreement struck, W H Smith, the newsagent to stationary retailer, agreed to hand over its 50 percent stake together with 50 million stg of investment. The share prices of both firms rose after news of the deal which ended partnership in the troubled firm.
Do-It-All, along with others in its sector, had suffered a difficult period due to a very sluggish housing market and low consumer spending on home improvement products.
Boots has said it will make reserve provisions of 80 million stg to cover costs stemming from the deal. Smiths will write down 45 million off its book value with 65 million of goodwill.
